answerText: Mars[10] This layer of the Martian surface dates to the Noachian epoch. Like its analogue on the moon, this fine-grained soil covering was produced mostly by meteoroid impacts and spallation.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | Penn A-Northmont-Chicago B | 15 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this planet, which is home to the huge Olympus Mons volcano.
